column4: sorry,  I should have qualified my question.  I mean to ask: how can I determine the specific model of my processor?
I know I've got a core2duo installed
I'd like to know the specific model
look in bios at boot
ok, that is certainly one way.  Given that this is a 64-bit cpu, if I wanted to install the 64-bit kernel, would I install the amd64 version?  that doesn't sound right to me as it's intel...
We try to encourage new users to stick with 32 bit until they get a better understanding of ubuntu/linux
there is little advantage with 64 unless you really need to access more than 4 gigs of ram

right, I understand this. but my question remains the same: where I to want to install the 64-bit version of ubuntu on my intel core2duo (assuming I had a reason to), would I download and install from the -amd64.iso or is there another avenue for intel 64?
yes amd
thank you
sorry, one more thing: can you direct me to a reference site that explains the differences between 32 and 64 bit linux (beyond the memory management)?
I cnnant think of one
ok, np, thanks anyway
I didnt think you could do pop on free accounts
yes, I have confirmed that.  I was just curious if there was an add-on to evolution such as webmail for thunderbird that would work around the pop limitation.
none that I am aware of whichis why I use gmail
thanks.  I use em both.  Maybe I should just forward my yahoo mail to gmail...
I didnt think they forwarded mail on free accounts either
looking now...
confirmed: you must have the mail plus account in order to forward.
Sorry. been there done that..
